results.title: One brick wall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Construction of one brick return angle. Use of two lines in walls more than one brick in thickness. Treatment at corners, toothing, racking back. Datum pegs and gauge rod. Laying of damp-proof courses, slates and bituminous felt. String and zinc tingles. Blacking out lines for piers. Protection of air brick by slate or Welsh arch. Construction of Welsh arch.

results.title: Halfbrick wall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Shows method for constructing a halfbrick wall including the first stage of constructing the corners; use of stretcher bond; the importance of checking with plumb level; the correct method of laying bricks, use of line and pins and corner blocks.

results.title: Circular and squint bays, gable knees, corbelling, tile creasing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Shows various methods of bricklaying including the trammel method for circular walls; templet method; obtuse angled wall, use of squint bricks, purpose made and hand cut; knee of oversailing brickwork; angle cuts for gable bricks; corbels for wall plate; corbelling for attached pier; tile creasing with brick-on-edge finish.
results.title_for_label: Circular and squint bays, gable knees, corbelling, tile creasing

results.title: Setting and fixing joinery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Shows method of setting and fixing joinery including bedding a stone sill; use of weather bar; temporary fixing of window frame frame; broken bond to accommodate frame when not brick size; fixing frames by metal tie, breeze brick and wood slip.

results.title: Arches
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Shows methods for building various arches including: Ringed arch - wooden centre supported by struts and wedge; use of “dead men” and line and pines for alignment; method of laying half brick rings; wedge shape of mortar joints; the collar joint. Axed arch - setting out for number and shape of cut bricks making templet; traversing; level; use of grub saw to transfer shape of templet to brick; cutting brick to shape; making joggle; formation of skewbacks; pencil guides on wooden centre stepped out by dividers; line to give correct radials; buttering and laying the bricks; grouting the joggles. Gauged arch - use of bricks called cutters or rubbers; method of squaring the face; use of cutting box, struts, saw and file; the reducing box; joggles; special application of mortar for joints; grouting; finishing.

results.title: Bricks and mortar
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
One of a series of 8 parts; the complete series gives a basic training in building construction with reference to brickwork. The film starts by describing classes of bricks; commons, facings, engineering, purpose-made, insulating and fire bricks, and deals with a number of varieties of individual types, their sizes and weights. The gauging of mortar is demonstrated. Hand and machine mixing and the pan mill are dealt with. The method of describing the thickness of walls in terms of brick lengths is explained.

results.title: Cavity walls
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
One of a series of eight films which gives a complete basic training in building construction with reference to brickwork. The purpose of cavity construction is explained and the methods employed are demonstrated. Treatment at the foot, damp-proof course, ties, prevention of fill-in of cavity by mortar droppings, installation of ventilation, cross walls, sealing off of window and door openings at sills and heads, fixing of joists and sealing of top of wall at the all plate.
results.description:

results.title: Bonds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
This film describes why different types of bonds are used and proceeds to demonstrate various bonds. It explains that “bonding” means to arrange bricks to a definite pattern according to function. A wall in “Flemish” bond is shown and its construction demonstrated in a one brick and a one and a half brick wall. “English” bond is then dealt with followed by “Dutch” bond. English and Flemish garden wall bonds bring the film to a close.

group_works.title: The Billings method
group_works.creator_credit: Jeremy Hogarth, John Acob and Michael Havas

results.title: The Billings method
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Hogarth, John Acob and Michael Havas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Breakthroughs”.
The Billings Method of Contraception - natural and only beginning to be accepted. Different from the Rhythm Method it boasts greater accuracy and reliability than any other method.
